      • registerElevationSource

        public static void registerElevationSource​(MosaicDatabase2 mosaic)
        Registers a catalog of elevation data. The supplied interface only needs to implement the MosaicDatabase2.query(MosaicDatabase2.QueryParameters) method.
        Parameters:
        mosaic -

      • getElevation

        public static double getElevation​(GeoPoint point,
                                  ElevationManager.QueryParameters filter)
        Returns the elevation, as meters HAE, at the specified location. A value of Double.NaN is returned if no elevation is available.
        Parameters:
        point - Geo point containing the latitude and longitude to query
        filter - The filter
        Returns:
        The elevation value at the specified location, in meters HAE, or Double.NaN if not available.

      • getElevation

        public static double getElevation​(GeoPoint point,
                                  ElevationManager.QueryParameters filter,
                                  GeoPointMetaData result)
        Returns the elevation, as meters HAE, at the specified location. A value of Double.NaN is returned if no elevation is available.
        Parameters:
        point - Geo point containing the latitude and longitude to query
        filter - The filter
        result - A geopoint metadata container to store the result data null if no additional metadata is desired.
        Returns:
        The elevation value at the specified location, in meters HAE, or Double.NaN if not available.

      • getElevationMetadata

        public static GeoPointMetaData getElevationMetadata​(double latitude,
                                                    double longitude,
                                                    ElevationManager.QueryParameters filter)
        Returns the elevation, as meters HAE, at the specified location within a GeoPointMetaData container.
        Parameters:
        latitude - The latitude to query
        longitude - The longitude to query
        filter - The filter
        Returns:
        A GeoPointMetaData containing the elevation.

      • getElevation

        public static boolean getElevation​(java.util.Iterator<GeoPoint> points,
                                   double[] elevations,
                                   ElevationManager.QueryParameters filter,
                                   ElevationData.Hints legacyHints)
        Returns elevation values for a set of points.
        Parameters:
        points - The points
        elevations - Returns the elevation values for the specified points
        legacyHints - If non-null specifies a minimum bounding box containing all points. The implementation may use this information to prefetch all data that will be required up front, possibly reducing IO.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the points or elevations parameters are incorrect.

      • getElevation

        public static boolean getElevation​(java.util.Iterator<GeoPoint> points,
                                   double[] elevations,
                                   ElevationSource.QueryParameters params)
        Returns elevation values for a set of points.
        Parameters:
        points - The points
        elevations - Returns the elevation values for the specified points
        params -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the points or elevations parameters are incorrect.

      • createHeightmap

        public static boolean createHeightmap​(double[] value,
                                      ElevationSource source,
                                      double gsd,
                                      ElevationManager.HeightmapParams params,
                                      ElevationManager.HeightmapStrategy strategy)
        Returns a heightmap for an ElevationSource.
        Parameters:
        value - an array to hold the results
        source - the elevation source providing the heightmap samples
        gsd - the resolution used to bound the queries per `strategy`
        params - the heightmap configuration
        strategy - the strategy used for heightmap construction
        Returns:
        true on success, false if one or more posts are not resolved

      • getGeoidHeight

        public static double getGeoidHeight​(double latitude,
                                    double longitude)
        Returns the geoid height at the specified location. Geoid height is the offset between MSL and the ellipsoid surface.

        Conversions are performed as follows:

        • hae = msl + geoidHeight
        • msl = hae - geoidHeight
        Parameters:
        latitude -
        longitude -
        Returns:
